Now I have a complete understanding of the codebase. Let me create the implementation plan:

**Current State:**
- Contact section (lines 593-599) has plain text links styled with `.accent-link`
- Existing button styles (`.btn`, `.btn-primary`) at lines 308-329 are not being utilized
- The buttons use system fonts with blue background (#0073B1)

**Goal:** Transform contact links into prominent CTA buttons for better visibility to recruiters.

entries.content: Now let me initialize the build-progress.txt file and record my findings:

I've created the implementation plan for enhancing the contact section with CTA buttons. Here's a summary:

## Implementation Plan Created

**Spec:** `009-enhance-contact-section-with-cta-buttons`

### Codebase Analysis
- **Current State:** Contact section (lines 593-599) uses plain `.accent-link` text styling
- **Opportunity:** Existing `.btn` and `.btn-primary` CSS classes (lines 308-329) are defined but unused
- **Single File:** All changes will be in `index.html` (contains embedded CSS)

### 5 Phases, 5 Subtasks

| Phase | Subtask | Description |
|-------|---------|-------------|
| 1 | 1.1 | Add `.btn-secondary` CSS class (teal outline style) |
| 2 | 2.1 | Apply button classes to LinkedIn & Twitter links |
| 3 | 3.1 | Increase button size/prominence for CTA impact |
| 3 | 3.2 | Update `.social-links-inline` layout for buttons |
| 4 | 4.1 | Add responsive styles for mobile touch targets |
| 5 | 5.1 | Visual verification and final review |

### Design Approach
- **LinkedIn:** Primary button (solid blue `#0073B1`) - main professional contact
- **Twitter:** Secondary button (teal `#36BCAB` outline) - social follow
- **Sizing:** Larger padding/font for prominent CTA appearance
- **Mobile:** Min 44px touch targets, proper spacing

**Estimated Effort:** 1-2 hours

Files created:
- `.auto-claude/specs/009-enhance-contact-section-with-cta-buttons/implementation_plan.json`
- `.auto-claude/specs/009-enhance-contact-section-with-cta-buttons/build-progress.txt`
I'll help you implement the secondary button style for the contact section CTA buttons. Let me start by understanding the context and current implementation.

entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 1.1 Complete

I've successfully implemented the secondary button style with teal accent color. Here's what was done:

### Implementation Details

**Added `.btn-secondary` CSS class** with the following properties:
- **Background:** Transparent (outline style)
- **Text Color:** Teal (`--color-teal-500: #36BCAB`)
- **Border:** 1px solid teal
- **Hover State:** Teal background with white text
- **Sizing:** Consistent with `.btn-primary`

**Enhanced `.btn` base class:**
- Updated transition to smoothly animate `background-color`, `color`, and `border-color` changes
- Ensures both primary and secondary buttons have smooth hover effects

### Acceptance Criteria ✓

- [x] `.btn-secondary` class added to styles
- [x] Uses teal accent color (`--color-teal-500`) for border and text
- [x] Transparent background with visible border
- [x] Hover state with teal background and white text
- [x] Maintains consistent sizing with `.btn-primary`

### Commits
1. `eb98506` - Added secondary button style implementation
2. `7ddfea6` - Updated plan status

The secondary button style is now ready to be applied to the contact section links in the next phase!
I'll help you implement subtask 2.1 to update the LinkedIn and Twitter links in the contact section. Let me start by reading the relevant files to understand the context and current implementation.

entries.content:
Perfect! I've successfully completed subtask 3.1. Here's a summary of what was done:

## ✅ Subtask 3.1 Completed: Enhanced Button Styling

### Changes Made:
1. **Increased font size** from `var(--text-xs)` (11px) to `var(--text-md)` (14px)
   - Improves readability and makes CTAs more prominent
   
2. **Increased padding** from `var(--space-2) var(--space-3)` (8px 12px) to `var(--space-3) var(--space-5)` (12px 20px)
   - Provides better click targets (~50% larger)
   - Gives buttons more visual weight and breathing room

### Benefits:
- ✅ Better visual impact as CTA buttons
- ✅ Improved readability with larger text
- ✅ Better click targets for both desktop and mobile
- ✅ Maintains proportional appearance
- ✅ Uses existing design system variables for consistency

### Verification:
The changes affect all `.btn` elements (both `.btn-primary` and `.btn-secondary`) in the contact section, making the LinkedIn and Twitter buttons more prominent and easier to interact with.

**Commit:** `30465a6` - "Update .btn base styles to use larger padding and font size"

The implementation is ready for the next subtask (3.2) which will adjust the `.social-links-inline` container layout to properly display these enhanced button elements.
I'll help you complete subtask 3.2 - adjusting the `.social-links-inline` container styles for button-styled elements. Let me start by reading the context and current implementation.
